results.title: Your 1800 Calorie Meal Plan Just Got a Major Upgrade
results.summary: This article from Organic Authority discusses how to improve an 1800 calorie meal plan by focusing on when you eat, how your brain affects food choices, social eating, personalizing the plan, and maximizing nutrient density. It suggests eating 40-45% of your calories before 2 PM and optimizing food combinations for better absorption. The article does not align with biblical principles, as it focuses on self-optimization rather than reliance on God for health and well-being. As 1 Corinthians 6:19-20 states, "What? know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost which is in you, which ye have of God? and ye are not your own? For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God's."

results.title: TikTok Bans #SkinnyTok, Impact Questionable
results.summary: USA TODAY reports TikTok banned #SkinnyTok for promoting unrealistic body standards and eating disorders. Influencers have shifted to wellness content, masking unhealthy practices. Experts warn of a return to the desire to be skinny, influencing disordered eating in young people. Users are advised to avoid interacting with such content. This promotes worldly standards and can be spiritually and mentally harmful, according to the Bible, which focuses on inner beauty and health (1 Peter 3:3-4).

results.title: NAP Faces 35% Cut in Food Stamp Benefits
results.summary: The Nutrition Assistance Program (NAP) in the CNMI may face a 35% decrease in food stamp benefits for fiscal year 2026 due to potential funding reductions from the U.S. Department of Agriculture. Administrator Margaret Aldan reported that only $34.8 million has been assured, compared to $48 million in the current year. The CNMI is seeking additional funding and considering transitioning to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), but faces challenges due to matching requirements. Secretary Frank Rabauliman noted that NAP serves 41,824 individuals, with the majority of funding coming from the federal government.

results.title: Kiwanis 'Khristmas in July Food Drive' Planned for July 26
results.summary: The Frankfort Kiwanis is holding its annual 'Khristmas in July Food Drive' on July 26th to support the Emergency Community of Franklin County. Donations of non-perishable food items like canned goods, peanut butter, and rice will be collected at Frankfort Kroger stores. Tim Reynolds emphasizes the mission to support children, aligning with biblical principles of charity: "Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me" (Matthew 25:40).
